summary: Masoom Hamdard is a natural resources management expert, with proven track record in environmental and water policy. Masoom is graduated from UNESCO-IHE Institute for Water Education in Delft the Netherlands, with Master degree in Environmental Science . He has worked as an adviser, consultant, researcher, and project manager in over eight countries including Afghanistan, Egypt, South Africa and the Netherlands, with organizations such as the World Bank, DFAT, JICA, OPM (Oxford Policy Management) and UNESCO-IHE Institute for Water Education in Delft . During his five years'tenure at the UNESCO-IHE Institute for Water Education in the Netherlands as Lecturer and Researcher, Masoom had the opportunity to teach and supervise graduate students, and implement research and capacity building projects in Africa and in Asia. Working at IHE helped in broadening his experience in higher education, including experience in designing and implementing curriculum as well as capacity building programmes.  Masoom remained country director for the DFID-funded Action-on-Climate-Today project in Afghanistan, and successfully led interventions that helped in mainstreaming climate change into national policies and strategies. This project resulted into devising Afghanistan's first Climate Budgeting Strategy, Climate Change Public Expenditure (CPEIR), Climate Resilient Water Strategy, and Climate-proofing of the Nature Resources Management strategy.  Later, Masoom served as Senior Institutional Adviser to the Minister of Agriculture for two years, seconded by the Australia's DFAT (Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade) and worked on files such as irrigation, natural resources management, and dryland agriculture farming. Masoom is a registered International Environmental Safeguards Adviser/Consultant at the World Bank, and works on short and medium term assignments with the Bank, when required.  Masoom has  also worked for United Nations Environment Programme on the State-of-the-Environment Report, for UNICEF on WASH project for rural areas.  Masoom has published in international journals and wrote reports for the European Union, USAID and World Bank, and is a member of review committee of the international journal on Society of Freshwater Science- South Asia Chapter.

-  leading the OPM's country portfolio for Afghanistan 
-  Project acquisition and proposal development

- Developing Environmental and Social Frameworks with Health and Safety aspects for development projects
- Preparing training modules and manuals for effective implementation of social and environmental plans 
-  Conducting assignment on the assessment of environmental and water legislation and regulations to support policy formulation
-  Research and advisory work for the improvement of water resources management

events", 'title': 'Sr. Consultant (Water, Environment, Natural Resources Management, and Climate Change)', 'employment_type': 'Freelance'}, {'location': 'Delhi, India ; Kabul, Afghanistan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'OXFORD POLICY MANAGEMENT LIMITED', 'description': "As ACT's Country Team Leader/Program Manager, I was overall responsible for leading OPM's portfolio and leading strategic discussions with government partners and donors in Afghanistan, and overseeing all financial and administrative matters of the project. Maintained smooth implementation of the project activities, and secured a number of landmark achievements that includes;
- The completion of the country’s first Climate Public Expenditures and Institutional Review (CPEIR) in collaboration with the Ministry of Finance of Afghanistan
- The mainstreaming of Climate Change into the Country’s National Natural Resources Management Strategy in collaboration with the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock (MAIL)
- The establishment of a National Climate Finance Unit withing the structure of National Environmental Protection Agency, and the consolidation of the country’s first National Steering Committee
of the Climate Action Network
- The completion of Afghanistan's Climate Resilient Water Strategy in collaboration with the Ministry of Energy in Water
- The completion of Afghanistan's Climate Change Budgeting Strategy in close consultation with Ministry of Finance
- The completion of the Operational Manual for the implementation of the Natural Resources Management Strategy.", 'title': 'Country Team Leader/Program Manager- Action on Climate Today (ACT)', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 8253, 'name': 'Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade; Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation & Livestock', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQE87WlinDn5Mw/company-logo_400_400/0/1675297247430?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=EnJ0V8My0i4n44PUkHohqHvIt3PwMSw6GxaYqllkbR8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/department-of-foreign-affairs-and-trade/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Kabul, Afghanistan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade', 'description': 'As Senior Adviser to the Minister of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock, I was overall responsible for the Irrigation and Natural Resources Management portfolio at the Ministry. As i was seconded by the DFAT, I led the Australian Government funded activities at the Ministry and was overall responsible for the project supervision, implementation and reporting. Few of my landmark accomplishments includes the completion of the Dryland Farming Policy and Strategy, and the formulation of first ever Irrigation Policy which i personally led, and the establishment of two centers of excellence for dryland farming. Support in developing materials that will help improve the teaching quality and bridge the gaps between teachers and students in the higher education. Technical support and inputs for developing 5 years Strategy Plans for each public university, and contributing to initiatives on increasing use of ICT technology in higher education including online course,  and improving quality of higher education through better accreditation system.', 'title': 'Adviser Higher Education Development Program', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 47985, 'name': 'IHE Delft Institute for Water Education', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHXH_eHPiEd_g/company-logo_400_400/0/1657195406388?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=nueNqX_5d8JCvBQFVd_V1xDSb39j1ZxCs_JctNd_yHw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/ihedelft/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Delft Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'IHE Delft Institute for Water Education', 'description': 'As Lecturer of the Environmental and Water Policy at UNESCO-IHE Institute for Water Education, I was actively engaged and leading activities in the areas of i) Education & Capacity Building, ii) Research, and iii) Project Management.
- In the field of education and capacity building, I successfully accomplished my 1 year diploma in "Teaching and Learning", which honed my teaching and capacity building skills. I was coordinator for three modules, and taught subjects on environmental planning and management, environmental impact assessment, strategic assessment, natural resources governance, environmental and social health and safety etc. 
- In the field of research, I focused on integrated planing, and environmental and social impacts assessment of development programs. I taught research methodology to various groups of students, and supervised MSc research projects of over 15 students.
- In the area of Projects, I was project lead for the the NICHE-Egypt project , that targeted activities related to the capacity building of the Ministry of Water Resources and Irrigation in Egypt under Netherlands Initiative for Capacity in Higher Education. Furthermore I was also project lead of a European Union Funded research project called AFOMAISON Africa at a meso scale- Integrated Natural Resources Management. The project was implemented in five African countries namely, Ethiopia, South Africa, Tunisia, Uganda and Mali.
-Despite the above mentioned activities, I also contributing to a number of tailor-made course in many Asian and African countries, mostly those projects were financed by the European Union. Led project proposals, took initiatives, and participated in a number of international seminars, conference and workshops such as Annual International Conference on Forestry in Yale University, US. International Conference on Water Governance by Water Commission of South Africa, etc.', 'title': 'Lecturer in Environmental (Water) Policy Making', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 47985, 'name': 'UNESCO-IHE', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHXH_eHPiEd_g/company-logo_400_400/0/1657195406388?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=nueNqX_5d8JCvBQFVd_V1xDSb39j1ZxCs_JctNd_yHw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/ihedelft/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Delft Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'IHE Delft Institute for Water Education', 'description': 'Hamdard was awarded Netherlands Fellowship Programme to follow Master of Science Programme at UNESCO-IHE Institute for Water Education based in Delft, The Netherlands. After completing his course work, Hamdard was offered to conduct research in Egypt in a European Union funded project called SWITCH (www.switchurbanwater.eu ), to look indepth in to the governance and technical challenges of water supply and sanitation for peri-urban areas. Hamdard successfully defended his research work in early April 2010. His research work is available on the project site : http://www.switchurbanwater.eu/outputs/pdfs/W6-4_CALE_PHD_MSc_Hamdard_Fresh_Water_Swaps_Wastewater_Reuse.pdf', 'title': 'Master of Science in Environmental Science, Specialization in Environmental Planning and Management', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'The World Bank, International Bank for Reconstruction & Development (IBRD', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Street 15, Wazir Akbar Khan,Kabul, Afghanistan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'company': 'The World Bank, International Bank for Reconstruction & Development (IBRD', 'description': "Hamdard's main responsibilities as Environmental Consultant were to support the Environmental Safeguards portfolio SASDN unit in Afghanistan, particularly in the World Bank funded projects such as Emergency Irrigation Rehabilitation Project , Rural Water and Sanitation Project, National Emergency Rural Access Project, National Solidarity Project together with the Environmental Specialist and in close consultation with relevant Task Team Leaders of the projects.  Hamdard  provided environmental support and worked with the SASDN unit as well as other sectors within the South Asia Sustainable Development Department on relevant activities in Afghanistan.   

Activities included, but are not limited, to the following:

- Assist clients with the application of Bank environmental safeguard policies;
 
- Participate with the Bank Task Teams in project supervision missions and contribute to Aide Memoires about the status and implementation of the Bank’s safeguards policies, effectiveness of the Environmental Management Framework in the  respective projects;

- Assist in the preparation of the TORs for conducting EAs, review of EA/EMF documents carried out by the client, and review compliance with Bank safeguard policies and quality acceptable to the Bank;

- Review all environmental screening associated with the EA process, including IEE, EIA, and EMP carried out by the client for each of the projects and provide feedback;

- Support on environment aspects of projects to Bank missions and task teams through out the project cycle, including preparation, pre-appraisal, appraisal, negotiations, and supervision, including by contributions to PADs, PCNs, etc. 

- Provide support to the Environment Specialist and the Task Team Leader on preparation for training client agencies’ staff on Environmental Safeguards and Environmental Management issues in the above mentioned WB funded projects;", 'title': 'Consultant, Environmental Safeguards', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 980754, 'name': 'Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development', 'logo': None, 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ministry-of-rural-rehabilitation-and-development/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Kabul, Afghanistan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'company': 'Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development', 'description': "Hamdard's main responsibilities as UNICEF Project Officer were to provide support for implementation of Water Supply and Environmental Sanitation (WES) projects in schools and Health Care Facilities (HCF) in rural Afghanistan.
Activities included, but were not limited to;

- Prepares technical designs and specification for constructions of sanitation projects with in Rural WatSan department; 
- Finalizes Bill of Quantity for sanitation latrines projects Implemented by Rural WatSan department.
- Review and control of designs prepared by other technical groups of NGOs and privet sectors and Implementing partners.
- Carry out technical monitoring of projects for sanitation facilities in Afghanistan. 
- Analyze of Construction Companies supposed to work for MRRD programs before contracts are awarded to them. 
- Technical Control and Analyzes of bid offers submitted by Construction Companies.
- Collect information and report of project progress and situations.
- Ability in organizing meetings, trainings and briefing on sanitation related aspects for Rural WatSan department, construction companies and NGOs. 
- Performing any other duties as required by the project", 'title': 'WASH Project Officer -UNICEF', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'UNEP- United Nations Environment Programme', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Kabul, Afghanistan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'company': 'UNEP- United Nations Environment Programme', 'description': "Hamdard's main responsibilities as Environmental Consultant with UNEP were to provide overall support in developing the first State of the Environment Report for Afghanistan.
